name: emulative
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
copying something achieved by someone else and trying to do it as well as they have: emulative of These short films were emulative of the work of other directors. An emulative rivalry is at the heart of many male friendships. Related word
emulateCompare
emulous
More examplesFewer examplesIn a fiercely competitive and emulative market, this decision could be decisive.The politicians were trying to encourage emulative action among their followers.They are trying to create a classroom environment that is emulative of the ideal conditions for natural learning.These building projects are emulative of Brazilian architecture.
